author: Ben Eisen
title: U.S. Companies Love That Weak Dollar, For Now
text:
0 COMMENTS The weak U.S. dollar continues to lend a helping hand to corporate results, but may turn into a drag if the greenback’s recent reversal continues.
The WSJ Dollar Index, which measures the currency against 16 peers, was down 4.8% at Thursday’s close from 52 weeks earlier. During that time the euro has risen 11% against the dollar and the British pound is up 10%
That’s a boon to U.S. companies with large international operations because a weaker currency makes products cheaper to sell abroad. Companies also benefit because their overseas earnings are more valuable when translated back to U.S. dollars, as The Wall Street Journal’s Morning MoneyBeat newsletter noted on Friday.
